title: This site's "Ask a question" goes into an infinite loop
creator: firefox.com.yes.really
content:
1 Login

2 On https://support.mozilla.org/bm/questions/new/thunderbird click " Ask a Question Continue"

(Land on https://support.mozilla.org/bm/kb/get-community-support?exit_aaq=1)

4 Click "Ask a Question Still need help? Continue to ask your question and get help."

(Land on https://support.mozilla.org/bm/questions/new )

5 Click Thunderbird - land on the page at 2 above, and enjoy your infinite loop.

Workaround: Stop wanting to Ask a Question and when you see GET HELP, click it.

Would anyone like to fix it? Preferably not the guy who wrote it...
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/109.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

content:

this is how it used to look:

title: 115.16.2 Google password is taken in a Thunderbird window! And Google accepts it!
creator: firefox.com.yes.really
content:
On Windows, Get Messages on a Gmail mailbox requests my Google Account password be entered in to a Thunderbird window: https://i.imgur.com/Q4Eivhk.png

That window obfuscates that is it from Thunderbird not my trusteed web browser by omitting the title bar icon.

Worse, Google actually accepts and acts upon this password.

No user in their right mind should be giving their Google password to Thunderbird. No non-Google app in its right mind should be taking Google passwords.

title: Thunderbird
creator: annagp3
content:
What has happened? I am in hell. I was in the middle of an email when Thunderbird was shutdown against my will and updated??? or whatever hell this is. I was also forced to use my google to sign in as you obviously do not care about a decent internet as you claim. I am so stressed now I don't know what to do and cannot find how to get help. So sick of being bullied by companies. So sick of it. I just wanted to look at my emails and answer a few and now it's a nightmare. You are just like the rest. Hypocrites. Why is there no help. And I don't mean the constant hoops ppl have to jump though just to have to find some shit article that never answers the questions, or some forum where no one ever answers the question either. Real help. But always no human just little lords at a distance. Such smug elitist cruelty. I thought Mozilla was supposed to be different. Nope. 

I now longer recognise what is in front of me.  I can't tell what is the beginning and the end? Everything is different and awful.  Why are my emails in alphabetical (from what I can tell) order? Why have the columns shifted?   There are no borders that I recognise?  Where is the search bar at the top so I can search emails from the same origin? Why are there no headings.

Why do you do this? I am now in a horrible mess. I need to see how things are arranged. I do not recognise what I was just looking at! Do you understand the enormity of this? I had several emails open that I need to keep track of. How do you justify this? How dare you do this and then tell us to be "nice" when you have forcefully inflicted updates and no help. Then open page where you ask for money for this injustice? I won't do that again. I cannot even find today's emails. Just why :/ This is wanker consultant behaviour - fixing/changing something that aint broke. It is obvious you despise non-tech people.

You have ruined my
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/128.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 OPR/114.0.0.0

title: Autorefresh inbox folder (It's not the same function as “Check if new messages have arrived every 1 minute)
creator: lukasz.cieciorowski
content:
I use one email account by two people, on two different computers.

To make sure each person knows what to do, we use labels. Everything works great. The labels appear on both computers.

However, in order for the labels to update, I have to go into some folder (other than received) open some email and go back to the “received” folder.

Is there any option/add-on to make the folders refresh every set time? (It's not the same function as “Check if new messages have arrived every 1 minute”.

Someone once had a partial solution with adding a button using the Custom Button plugin, but it currently doesn't work.

https://forums.mozillazine.org/viewtopic.php?t=2877113

title: Inconsistent behaviour with single/double spacing
creator: bainion.romello
content:
Hi,

When I write a new email, if I press [Enter] I get double spacing between paragraph. I know that if I want a single space I can press [Ctrl]+[Enter] so that is not a problem. The problem is that when I answer some emails (not all!), even though I selected Paragraph and not Body Text in Format > Paragraph, I get single spacing when pressing [Enter].

Any idea why and how to fix it?

I'm using Thunderbird v.128.3.3esr (64-bit) and also had the problem on v.115.9.0 (64-bit) on Windows 10 22H2

title: Strange character strings in incoming e-mail
creator: toukie
content:
Hi, I'm using Thunderbird 128.3.3esr (64-bit) on my laptop. Re msgs. that contain links, which I ought to be able to click and then access using Firefox, beginning a few days ago instead of links the messages contain odd character strings, e.g.

--_004_1C04A1984E9745B4A7771C4CE3817E28allecracom_--

and nothing else. However, if I forward these same msgs. from my Android phone (e-mail client: Fairmail) back to my e-mail acc't and then open them on my laptop, they contain the links, which I can open by clicking on them.

Why have a suddenly started getting these odd character strings in Thunderbird e-mails containing links, and how do I get the links to appear without having to go the circuitous route of forwarding e-mails from my phone?

Thx in advance to all responders.

title: Supernova, threading issues
creator: fred.d1
content:
Just been upgraded to current Supernova on a laptop while away (misclick by family member) and can't back out til I'm home, so really struggling with all those topics that were hot a year ago and now archived.

But specifically with message threading.

I have never used threading ever on any of my clients. I organise with subfolders, deleting and archiving because my primary index has always been date or sender I have here 6 email accounts and about 500 folders and subfolders.

Magically post upgrade they all seem to have threaded view enabled and that, along with the changes in the highlighting of new messages, the garish styles used and the loss of screen real estate on a small laptop are making everything take five times as long while I try to find fixes but mainly workarounds to get at the information I need.

Please, can anyone confirm that threading has been turned on by default in Supernova (If so I'd love to know why but that's for another day and the grumpy old man forums) Please can anyone tell me a way to quickly disable this across all my email accounts and subfolders - one command per account would be acceptable but a command per subfolder is useles to me.

...and for when I get back to base, now we're over a year from Supernova hitting the streets, can anyone confirm whether I can just downgrade the Thunderbird installation or am I screwed with new TB data structures and need to delete all and just install the old client, recreate the accounts and just sync with the Imap servers again.

Appreciate these Qs have probably been asked before but having spent 45 minutes searching, I've only found partial answers and I need to spend time on using and doing.

Thanks
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:131.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/131.0

title: Only messages with attachments appear on the screen
creator: mail4marcia
content:
My wife (the Marcia in "mail4marcia") and I are using Thunderbird 128.3.3esr (64-bit) on an Acer Windows 11 computer.

Sometime within the last couple of days some control or setting must have changed and only emails that have attachments display in any of the email messages lists in Thunderbird. I tried testing this by sending two tiny emails from another computer to this one. One msg had a tiny attachment, the other did not. On the Acer computer, both messages appeared in indicators that each msg was received, but only the msg with the attachment appeared in my inbox. I then removed the attachment from the email that had it and the email immediately disappeared from my inbox display. I looked at a few mail folders that I rarely use. In some of them there were headings for few or no msgs, in the display but the mailbox index for the folder said that there were unread emails there.

I checked my settings, looked for add-ons and themes that we have (don't think we have any), and searched the Internet. No luck. Does anyone have any experience with this or any ideas about what can be tried?

I'm going to be in a place where Internet access is poor and I may not see your answers until a little over two weeks from now. If I don't respond until after that, please forgive me.

Thank you. 

   Alan
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:131.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/131.0;solver_id:6255480

title: All my old email previous october, 28 have disapeard.

content: I have been using a email client since 1999, Outlook express at first and later thunderbird for almost 20 years. I have a hotmail (pop) account and a Gmail ( pop) account. Last friday, thunderbird got blocked and could not complete to download 6 messages. I had to stop de program. Those messages were visible on the webmail but Thunderbird never succeded to download them. I have had to forward them to myself to have them to get into my inbox. I removed a program called RAV endpoint protection that got in my computer recently and i tought it could be the cause. Later I noticed that all my all email i had since 1999 had disappeard. I have removed and reinstalled thunderbird yesterday. Now I can only see the email arrived since the new installation. Il have other accounts, imap and older email are still visible. Where a all those hundred of mails now? How can find them back? Many of them are still on the webmail but i have deleted many old one because i tought they were keept safely in thunderbird.

title: Outlook, PST, EML and local folders
creator: nojunk217
content:
Hi,

I need help on topic "Outlook, PST, EML and local folders".

I have .. - Win 10, 64 bit - Outlook 2010 - current thunderbird, first time installed 10 days ago (newbie!) - a huge, locally stored PST file with a lot of folders, like "in_2014 / In_2015 / .. / Out_2014 / Out_2015"

I want .. - to have access to the mails in the PST with Thunderbird.

I did .. - read some information and found that there is no direct access - install ImportExportTools NG - tried to import "Via Outlook", but failed: "No profile found". I think Outlook 2010 is too old - install "Outlook Viewer" from CoolUtils. Opened the PST, exported a lot of EML-files, one for every single mail. - defined a "Local folder", called "in_2014" - copied the EMLs to this folder. They appear in the folder-tree of Thunderbird, but not as single "mails". I have to open (doubleclick) every EML to see the mail. - tried to "Import" the data (one by one / many together / from folder) to the local folder, but got a long error message with a lot a strange error-codes - tried to export data from PST to one single EML with many mails in it. Failed, the software does not offer this feature. - tried to "Import" the EML to a folder of a mail account. This was successful, but only the first step. - tried to move / copy the currently imported mails from mail-account to my local folder: failed again without reaction and without message.

What can I do now? How to get mails from a PST to a locally stored, Thunderbird readable structure?

Thanks in advance for help.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:132.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/132.0;solver_id:6255657

title: How to reorganize Address Books in TB 115?
creator: lbecker
content:
I want to declutter my list of address books (see attached screenshot) by copying (or moving) the contents of some of them so that their contents appear in a different address book as "subfolders" (i.e., as a lists) nested within that address book. I can then hide the lists and delete the address books whose contents I copied. I've tried several ways to do this but have had no success. For example, I selected a set of contacts within one of the address books, then clicked on New List, typed a List Name, selected an address book where I wanted the contacts to go, and clicked OK. A new list was created within the selected address book but only the names and email addresses of those contacts appeared in the address book. I'd like all the info for the contacts to be copied to the selected address book.

Any ideas for how to do this?

Thanks for your help.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:109.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/115.0
